result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Ezell Royston was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 42 months bifurcated sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees. DNA surcharge fee assessed.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Defendant may not have any alcohol in or on the premises of home.  Defendant may not go into any establishments that sell alcohol except for restaurants and grocery stores.
Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent, including alcohol treatment, psychological and psychiatric treatment and counseling. Firearm warning  and voting rights given. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation. ***Deft is eligible for the substance abuse program once 12 months of the Deft's sentence is completed***

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: ***6-2-15 MODIFY CONDITIONS OF BOND TO REMOVE THE SCRAM UNIT, DEFT MUST BE TESTED AT LEAST 3 TIMES PER WEEK***  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  $208 advanced fee for installment of SCRAM must be paid prior to release from jail. Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) to monitor - 524 S Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780).  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Ezell  Royston in court with attorney Wendy S. Paul.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Deft is engaged in treatment at the V.A. clinic.
Def is moving to modify bond to remove the SCRAM unit.
State is not going to object.
BTC: Motion granted, modify bond to remove the SCRAM unit, deft must be tested at least 3 times per week.
